meanings.definition: More morally wrong or bad than others.
meanings.sent1: The eviller villain plotted to steal all the candy from the children.
meanings.sent2: The eviller actions of the dictator shocked the entire nation.
meanings.sent3: The eviller character in the story always wore a black cape and cackled loudly.
meanings.sent4: The eviller intentions of the witch turned the forest into a dark and twisted place.
meanings.sent5: The eviller deeds of the pirate captain were known far and wide.

meanings.definition: More harmful or destructive than others.
meanings.sent1: The eviller storm destroyed houses and uprooted trees in its path.
meanings.sent2: The eviller effects of pollution are evident in the declining health of the river.
meanings.sent3: The eviller chemicals in the experiment caused a small explosion in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The eviller force of the tsunami swept away everything in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The eviller wildfire spread rapidly through the dry forest, leaving devastation in its wake.
